II. By reason of your being my husband, and out of the love and affection I have for you, and with the intention of giving you some immovable property free of charge, I hereby grant you immediate possession of all the immovable property to which I have acquired the right by virtue of my father's lineage as set out in paragraph 3 below, and which is in my possession, and which has not been mortgaged or encumbered by any other person, amounting to Rs. 11,43,000/- (in words) Eleven Lakhs Forty Three Thousand Rupees, having a market value of Rs. 11,43,000/- (in words), and which has been acquired free of charge, in consideration of the love I have for you. From now on, you shall register your name in the accounts of the government and pay taxes, etc., and enjoy the said property in the happiness and freedom of your son, grandson, and descendants with all the powers of loan, donation, and sale. Whatever disputes arise regarding this property, whether by anyone or not, I will completely resolve them on my own responsibility and execute this property to you without any interruption.
This property is not an assignment property as per the Andhra Pradesh Assigned Lands Act 2/1977.
I hereby declare that the property to be settled by this property does not include any mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato trees, plantations, precious minerals, mines, granite or other stone quarries, machinery, fish ponds, etc. and I agree to be prosecuted and liable to pay the appropriate fee if any such material fact is concealed in this deed in the future. Any concealment of facts in this matter may be prosecuted in court under sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act. ch. china devudamma麵

I hereby certify that the property being settled by this deed, i.e. the property to which I have acquired the right by descent, is free from all other rights except me, that I have not so far sold or transacted this property to anyone and that I have not committed any encroachments. In the course of preparing this deed, I have thoroughly examined all the necessary documents such as the deed link documents, mortgage/encumbrance certificates, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details etc. and have incorporated them in this deed. I have physically inspected the Scheduled Property, had it measured and the deed drawn up. I will take full responsibility for any discrepancies in the above matters in the future.

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL: Krishnapuram/SITE(0-0) W-B: 0-0 SURVEY: 6 , LP no: 111 HOUSE: 162-1 EXTENT: 64.555SQ.Yds BUILT: 608SQ. FT Boundires: [N]: nayanammapalem road [S] house of ko diboyina parvathalu [E]: panchayathi c c ro ad [W]: house of kanithi lakshmi

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 443 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Chevveti Chinademudamma in favour of her Husband, Chevveti Venkataramana towards the property admeasuring an extent of 67.555 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-162 (Old) & 162-1 (New), Assessment number 162 (Old) and 235505000113 (New), comprised in survey number 6 Part, situated in Krishnapuram Shivaru Rukminipuram Village, Krishnapuram Panchayath, Yelamanchili Mandal, within the District of Anakapalli, registered at sub-registrar office Yelamanchili (310) is bounded as follows: North by: Nayanammapalem Road South by: House Of Kodiboyina Parvathalu East by: Panchayathi Cc Road West by: House Of Kanithi Lakshmi. Note: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:It is to be noted that there is mismatch with the extent between Deed "67.555 Sq. Yds. "and EC "64.555 Sq. Yds. ", it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain updated EC as per Deed. Further, The EC has been verified and downloaded using the document number parameter, as the option to retrieve EC records using the property address is currently unavailable in the Online EC portal.
